messages.title: David Morgan For Greenbank
messages.content: I am seeking your support in this election, so I can work alongside your current local Green Party councillor, Lawrence Brown...

messages.title: Martin Dobson heading to be Liverpool's first Green Party MP
messages.content: At this election you can make a real change for the better. Vote Green to invest in our future and end austerity.

messages.title: HOW TO USE YOUR VOTES FOR DAVID AND MARTIN
messages.content: IMPORTANT - There are TWO elections on Thursday May 7th. The ballot papers will be WHITE for the General Election and YELLOW for the local council vote.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improving local transport options including support for safe cycling
Safeguarding green spaces from built development including the beautiful and historic Sefton Park Meadows
Protecting our local libraries from closure
An extension to recycling in the city to enable more items to be recycled as happens in other local authorities
Defending sure start centres from closure
Support of national aims of ending austerity and giving more money back to local authorities

mentions.tacticalSituation: The 'Green Surge' in support shows that the Green Party can win here!

issues.economy: The green Party offer a positive alternative to austerity.
issues.education: Defending sure start centres from closure.
issues.environment: Safeguarding green spaces from built development.
issues.health: To fight against the cuts and to save our NHS.

images.caption: David Morgan and Martin Dobson featured on the campaign leaflet.

leaflet.additionalNotes: COMPARE THE GREEN PARTY POLICIES WITH THE OTHERS While Labour and the Tories fight over who can cut the most, Martin Dobson and the Green Party offer a positive alternative to austerity.
